intro: Spiniluma buxifolia, commonly known as the boxleaf spurge, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It features small, fleshy leaves that are typically green or reddish in color, arranged in a compact, bushy form. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a striking contrast to its foliage. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions with minimal water requirements. Spiniluma buxifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and ornamental appeal.
